sentences: Kõik kõigist asjadest on meie jaoks olulised.
Ta rääkis hästi kõigest peale kõigist tähtsamat teemast.
See raamat kõigist teadmistest on parim mida olen lugenud.
context: The word 'kõigist' is the elative case (third position) plural form of the Estonian pronoun 'kõik', meaning 'all'. The '-st' ending indicates movement away from or origin, so 'kõigist' means 'from all' or 'out of all'. It's used when something comes out of a group that contains everything. In English, this would be translated as 'from all', 'of all', or sometimes 'out of all' depending on the context.
